page.title: 16Farming In Whitchurch
page.content: Farming was formerly the main occupation in the Whitchurch area. There were numerous,long-established, small farms,most employing several local people.The oldest being the medieval Lyons Court. Much farmland, particularly around Whitchurch village,has been sold for residential development,links with the past being retained in estate and road names. Nowadays farming is still very much in evidence,but the pattern has changed.There are fewer farms now but of larger size.Often,small adjacent farms have been amalgamated.Except for Newbarn Farm,these are all family run and few local people now work on the land. The existing farms are all livestock units with dairy cattle,beef cattle, sheep and pigs all being kept and crops grown mainly for animal feed.
